titlePart.text: TEXTILES AND FLEXIBLE MATERIALS NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR
FLEXIBLE MATERIALS NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR

titlePart.entryReference: see , for chemical matters apparatus for blocking, pressing, steaming, or stretching hats

noteParagraph.text: This sub-class includes domestic and laundry dry-cleaning apparatus using volatile solvents.
This sub-class includes domestic, laundry, and tailors' ironing or other hot-pressing of clothes, linen, and other textile articles.
Apparatus for wringing, washing, dry-cleaning, ironing, and other hot-pressing of textiles in manufacturing operations is provided for in , .

titlePart.text: the tub walls or bottom having corrugations
with special means for water circulation by heat, e.g. fountain-washers
Racks or other rigid open containers of skeleton or like apertured construction supporting clothes in washing receptacles
Hand rubbers, e.g. gloves with corrugated surfaces
Hand implements for washing purposes, e.g. sticks
Plungers, dollies, pounders, squeezers, or the like
adapted for removable mounting on receptacles such as wash-tubs
Washing devices adapted to be used independently of any particular receptacle, e.g. for removable mounting on wash-tubs, bath-tubs, or the like
agitating the washing liquid by air
Washing machines using rollers, e.g. of the mangle type
Washing machines having receptacles, stationary for washing purposes, with agitators therein contacting the articles being washed
titlePart.entryReference: plungers or the like adapted for removable mounting on receptacles
washing devices adapted to be used independently of any particular receptacle

titlePart.text: wherein the agitator has an oscillatory rotary motion only
wherein the agitator has an axial motion only
wherein the agitator has both rotary, e.g. oscillating rotary, motion and axial motion
wherein the agitator has a gyratory or orbital motion

titlePart.entryReference: plungers or the like adapted for removable mounting on receptacles

titlePart.text: wherein the articles being washed are squeezed by a flexible diaphragm or bag

titlePart.entryReference: washing devices adapted to be used independently of any particular receptacle

titlePart.text: solely by gases, e.g. air or steam, introduced into the washing liquid
Washing machines having receptacles, stationary for washing purposes, and having further drying means

generating sonic or ultrasonic vibrations in general

titlePart.entryReference: with receptacles serving both for washing and centrifugally draining ,
with receptacles moving bodily about an axis

titlePart.text: the receptacle having a wobbling motion
with rubbing or beating means not secured to, or forming part of, the receptacle

and rotating or oscillating about a vertical axis
and rotating or oscillating about an inclined axis

Washing machines with receptacles moving bodily, e.g. reciprocating, swinging
Combinations of a washing machine with other separate apparatus in a common frame or the like, e.g. with rinsing apparatus
Washing installations comprising an assembly of several washing machines or washing units, e.g. continuous flow assemblies
Controlling a series of operations in washing machines, e.g. programme-control arrangements for washing and drying cycles
Washing machines, apparatus, or methods not otherwise provided for

adapted for rotation or oscillation about a horizontal or inclined axis
Ribs, lifters, or rubbing means forming part of the receptacle

Ribs or rubbing means forming part of the receptacle

in machines with a receptacle rotating or oscillating about a vertical axis
for rotating the receptacle at one speed only
for rotating the receptacle at more than one speed

Stands for supporting the roller framework

titlePart.entryReference: supports or holders specially adapted or mounted for storing and repeatedly paying-out and restoring lengths of lines
